Welcome to ECE 229 Group 6 Project's documentation!¶

This project is a Bank Telecaller Decision Support System.

The main purpose is to help bank manager and telecaller quickly target customers who are more likely to subscribe to their product.

Package Dependencies¶

The project depends on plotly, dash, numpy, pandas, sklearn, xgboost and scikit-learn, etc. The packge version is listed below:

For Data Analysis:

->plotly                        4.4.1
->numpy                         1.16.4
->pandas                        0.24.2

For Prediction:

->xgboost                       1.1.0
->sklearn                       0.0
->scikit-learn                  0.22.2.post1
->pandas                        1.0.3
->numpy                         1.18.1

For Dashboard Development:

->dash                          1.12.0
->dash-core-components          1.10.0
->dash-html-components          1.0.3
->dash-renderer                 1.4.1
->dash-table                    4.7.0
->plotly                        4.8.0

For Test:

->coverage                      5.1
->pytest                        5.0.1
->numpy                         1.16.4
->pandas                        0.24.2

class visualization.analysis.FeatureAnalysis(csv_path)¶

Exposes DataFrames with binned ages self.df_binned and encoded labels self.df_encoded

get_feature_importance() → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Generates feature weights using random forest

Returns

A DataFrame with feature weights

class visualization.analysis.MaritalAnalysis(csv_path)¶

Filters unknown marital status types from self.df

visualization.analysis.number_to_day_of_week(df: Union[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, pandas.core.series.Series, Iterable]) → Union[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, pandas.core.series.Series, Iterable]¶

Returns a DataFrame, Series, or Iterable with integers converted to the appropriate abbreviated day of the week. 0 returns an empty string. Values outside [0 6] will raise an IndexError :param df: a pandas.DataFrame or pandas.Series object with integer values ranging from 0 to 6

visualization.analysis.number_to_month(df: Union[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, pandas.core.series.Series, Iterable]) → Union[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, pandas.core.series.Series, Iterable]¶

Returns a DataFrame, Series, or Iterable with integers converted to the appropriate abbreviated month. 0 returns an empty string. Values outside [0 12] will raise an IndexError :param df: a pandas.DataFrame or pandas.Series object with integer values ranging from 0 to 12

Result Prediction¶

class src.feature_extraction.FeatureExtractor(wd='../', filepath='data/bank-additional-full.csv')¶

Feature extractor class for the bank data set. Calls pre_processing code and pre-processes the data. Then conducts the feature extraction tasks. :param wd: The default working directory. It should be set to the location of the src folder. For example: 'C:/Users/iocak/Desktop/git/ECE229-Project/src' :type wd: str, optional :param file_path: Location of the csv data file. Pass the location of 'bank-additional-full.csv' if you would like to change the default data path. :type file_path: str, optional

data_scaler(prep, scale_time=False)¶

Normalize the numerical variables. Subtract mean and divide by standard deviation.

Parameters

  • prep (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) -- A pandas dataframe of preprocessed data.

  • scale_time (bool, optional) -- If True scales time columns(month, day_of_week) as well, default is False.

Returns

A pandas dataframe with the scaled numerical features.

Return type

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

get_features(scale=True)¶

Get final features. This method first preprocesses the data and then does the feature extraction. Finally it one-hot-encodes the data. These processes are done by using class methods.

Parameters

scale (bool) -- True by default, scales the features.

Returns

Final features to be used in machine learning tasks. (Pandas DataFrame)

Return type

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

get_train_test_split(test_size=0.2, random_state=1, scale=True)¶

Train test splitting with desired parameters. Uses the result of get_features() method internally.

Parameters

  • test_size (float, optional) -- Test data size as the fraction of whole data size.

  • random_state (float, optional) -- Random state to be used in splitting.

  • scale (bool, optional) -- True by default, scales the features.

Returns

Train features, train labels, test features, test labels are returned in separate Pandas Dataframes in a tuple size of 4.

Return type

tuple

load_preprocessed_data()¶

Imports pre_processing library from src folder and loads the preprocessed data. If the change_wd option is True in the class constructor then imports pre_processing library from the new location else uses the default working directory. While reading the data uses the filepath string that was passed in the class constructor.

Returns

'df' which is the preprocessed Pandas dataframe.

Return type

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

one_hot_encoder(df, encode_time=True)¶

Do one hot encoding on the provided dataframe

Parameters

  • df (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) -- A pandas dataframe of bank data to be one-hot-encoded.

  • encode_time (bool, optional) -- Default is True. If True the columns month and day_of_week are one_hot_encoded too. Otherwise they are kept as integers.

Returns

A pandas dataframe with the scaled numerical features.

Return type

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

src.feature_extraction.get_feature_extractor(wd='', filepath='data/bank-additional-full.csv')¶

Kickstart the FeatureExtractor class.

Parameters

  • wd (str, optional) -- The default working directory. It should be set to the location of the src folder. For example: 'C:/Users/iocak/Desktop/git/ECE229-Project/src'

  • file_path (str, optional) -- Location of the csv data file. Pass the location of 'bank-additional-full.csv' if you would like to change the default data path.

Returns

Returns a FeatureExtractor object.

Return type

class:FeatureExtractor

class src.pre_processing.DfBankAdditional(filepath)¶

To be used with the bank-additional dataset from: https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/Bank+Marketing# Pass a pandas.DataFrame to the constructor to get started

Parameters

filepath (str) -- file path of bank dataset csv.

process_all()¶

The dataframe is modified in-place, replacing unknown values with np.NaN, false values with 0, and true values with 1. This behavior can be modified by changing the class attribute mappings

re_map_column(column: str)¶

Applies the mapping in the self.mappings dict to the column name in column

Parameters

column (str) -- name of the pd.DataFrame column to re-map

src.pre_processing.load_data(path: str) → src.pre_processing.DfBankAdditional¶

Loads the csv located at path :param path: a string path to the bank-additional-full.csv file :return: a DfBankAdditional

src.prediction.column_eliminator(data)¶

Eliminate columns from the feature data

Parameters

prep (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) -- A pandas dataframe of the feature data.

Returns

A pandas dataframe with the final features to be used in prediction.

Return type

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

src.prediction.make_predictions(model='xgb', tune=False, save=False, wd='')¶

Train a desired model and make predictions on the test data

Parameters

  • model (str) -- Name of the model to be used. Possible values: 'lr', 'rf', 'xgb'

  • tune (bool) -- False by default, make it True if you want to tune the hyper parameters

  • save (bool) -- False by default, make it True if you want to save the result, the results will be saved to /data folder.

  • wd (str) -- Path of the working directory, you need to provide the location of the git folder.

Returns

Predictions on the test data with the original test features.

Return type

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

util.dynamic_predict(nr_employed=0, poutcome_success=0, emp_var_rate=0, pdays=0, cons_conf=0, euribor=0, no_income=0)¶

Create predictions for new customers. Enter the inputs and get the probability.

Parameters

  • nr_employed (numpy.ndarray or list or int or float) -- number of employees - quarterly indicator (numeric)

  • poutcome_success (numpy.ndarray or list or int or float) -- outcome of the previous marketing campaign (binary: 1 if success, 0 otherwise)

  • emp_var_rate (numpy.ndarray or list or int or float) -- employment variation rate - quarterly indicator (numeric)

  • pdays (numpy.ndarray or list or int or float) -- number of days that passed by after the client was last contacted from a previous campaign (numeric; 999 means client was not previously contacted)

  • cons_conf (numpy.ndarray or list or int or float) -- consumer confidence index - monthly indicator (numeric)

  • euribor (numpy.ndarray or list or int or float) -- euribor 3 month rate - daily indicator (numeric)

  • no_income (numpy.ndarray or list or int or float) -- binary income indicator, 1 if the customer job retired, student or unemployed

Returns

Array of predicted probabilities

Return type

numpy.ndarray

Test¶

Test cases for analysis.py file where we perform preliminary analysis on the data.

test.test_analysis.test_filter_unknown_marital()¶

Tests filter_unknown_marital() fucntion in analysis.py. The filter_unknown_marital() function is used to filter out columns that have marital status field set to unknown. The test_filter_unknown_marital() checks to ensure that the filtered values do not contain unknown marital status.

test.test_analysis.test_get_age_prob_success()¶

Tests get_age_prob_success() fucntion in analysis.py. The get_age_prob_success() function is used to compute the probability of a person subscribing to the term deposit based on the age group they fall into. The test_get_age_prob_success() checks if the percentage value returned is expected by ensuring that the percentage is in between 0 and 100 and the returned values are either floats or ints.

test.test_analysis.test_get_column()¶

Tests get_column() fucntion in analysis.py. The get_column() function is used to retrieve a column from the dataset. The get_column function accepts the column name as an argument and returns the column from the dataframe.

test.test_analysis.test_get_count()¶

Tests get_count() fucntion in analysis.py. The get_count() fucntion is used to compute the total number of customers contacted. The get_count() function accepts the column name as an argument and returns the total number of customers contacted depending on the different categorical values that the column takes. The test_get_count() checks if the value returned is expected by ensuring that the number returned is greater than 0 and the returned values are ints.

test.test_analysis.test_get_feature_importance()¶

Tests get_feature_importance() fucntion in analysis.py. The get_feature_importance() function is used get a dataframe of feature importance The test_get_feature_importance() checks to ensure that the returned values are a pandas DataFrame object.

test.test_analysis.test_get_probabilities()¶

Tests get_probabilities() fucntion in analysis.py. The get_probabilities() function is used to compute the probability of a customer subscribing to the term deposit plan. The get_probabilities function accepts the column name as an argument and returns the probability of a customer saying yes to the term deposit plan depending on the different categorical values that the column takes.

test.test_analysis.test_get_success_count()¶

Tests get_success_count() fucntion in analysis.py. The get_success_count() function is used to compute the number of customers subscribing to the term deposit plan. The get_success_count() function accepts the column name as an argument and returns the number of customers subscribing to the term deposit plan depending on the different categorical values that the column takes. The test_get_success_count() checks if the value returned is expected by ensuring that the number returned is greater than 0 and the returned values are ints.

test.test_analysis.test_map_age()¶

Tests map_age() function in analysis.py. The mapping of age to age group is done by mapping age to labels. This function checks if the labels and mapping have consistent data types.

test.test_analysis.test_number_to_day_of_week()¶

Tests number_to_day_of_week() fucntion in analysis.py. The number_to_day_of_week() function is used return the days of the week corresponding to the enumeration of days given in the dataframe. The test_number_to_day_of_week() checks to ensure that the returned values are days of the week and there are no stray values that are being returned.

test.test_analysis.test_number_to_month()¶

Tests number_to_month() fucntion in analysis.py. The number_to_month() function is used return the months corresponding to the enumeration of months given in the dataframe. The test_number_to_month() checks to ensure that the returned values are months and there are no stray values that are being returned.

test.test_analysis.test_percentage_of_population()¶

Tests percentage_of_population() fucntion in analysis.py. This function is used to compute the percentage of customers subscribing to the term deposit plan. The percentage_of_population() function accepts the column name as an argument and returns the percentage of customers subscribing to the term deposit plan depending on the different categorical values that the column takes. The test_percentage_of_population() checks if the percentage value returned is expected by ensuring that the percentage is in between 0 and 100 and the returned values are either floats or ints.
